meaningMnemonic: A <kanji>cold</kanji> <kanji>cold</kanji> person is so cold that they're super cool. They're sooo cool and <vocabulary>gallant</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>manly</vocabulary>. Touch a manly person and feel how cold their skin is. It's like that all the way down to their heart.
readingMnemonic: Usually when you see 々 it means that the reading is two on'yomi readings repeating. Well this is a bit of an exception. Saying りんりん is kinda hard so just drop the んs and you'll have the reading りり!
